perturbation.original_text: Distributor shall pay Company within thirty (30) days of Distributor's or, as the case may be, the end-user's receipt of Products.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor shall pay Company within sixty (60) days of Distributor's or, as the case may be, the end-user's receipt of Products. However, for the first year of this agreement, the payment term is ninety (90) days.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by initially stating that the Distributor shall pay the Company within 60 days of receipt of products, but then creating an exception specifying a payment term of 90 days for the first year. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding which payment deadline should be enforced during the initial year of the contract, therefore, creating an in-text contradiction on the payment terms.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Distributor shall pay Company within sixty (60) days of Distributor's or, as the case may be, the end-user's receipt of Products. However, for the first year of this agreement, the payment term is ninety (90) days.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement shall be ten (10) years (the "Term") which shall commence on the date upon which the Company delivers to Distributor the last Sample, as defined hereinafter. If Distributor complies with all of the terms of this Agreement, the Agreement shall be renewable on an annual basis for one (1) year terms for up to another ten (10) years on the same terms and conditions as set forth herein. All renewals of this Agreement shall be on the same terms and conditions as are set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement shall be ten (10) years (the "Term") which shall commence on the date upon which the Company delivers to Distributor the last Sample, as defined hereinafter. If Distributor complies with all of the terms of this Agreement, the Agreement shall be renewable on an annual basis for one (1) year terms for up to another five (5) years on the same terms and conditions as set forth herein. All renewals of this Agreement shall be on different terms and conditions as are set forth herein, which the two parties would have to come into agreement on.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the number of years that the contract can be renewed, from ten years to five years. As well as stating that all renewals of this Agreement shall be on different terms and conditions as are set forth herein, which the two parties would have to come into agreement on. This contradicts the initial term that set forth on the same terms and conditions of the original agreement, therefore, creating an in-text contradiction on the terms of the contract
perturbation.contradicted_text: The term of this Agreement shall be ten (10) years (the "Term") which shall commence on the date upon which the Company delivers to Distributor the last Sample, as defined hereinafter. If Distributor complies with all of the terms of this Agreement, the Agreement shall be renewable on an annual basis for one (1) year terms for up to another five (5) years on the same terms and conditions as set forth herein. All renewals of this Agreement shall be on different terms and conditions as are set forth herein, which the two parties would have to come into agreement on.

perturbation.original_text: Company will carry a reasonable amount of product liability insurance through a reasonably acceptable products liability insurance company and will name the Distributor as an additional insured under that policy. Company will make reasonable efforts to procure a policy, which is non-cancelable, except upon thirty (30) days, advance notice to the Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: Company will carry a reasonable amount of product liability insurance through a reasonably acceptable products liability insurance company but will not name the Distributor as an additional insured under that policy. Company will make reasonable efforts to procure a policy, which is non-cancelable, except upon fifteen (15) days, advance notice to the Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing who the beneficiary of the product liability insurance is and changing how much notice the Distributor would get. Initially, the distributor was a beneficiary, now they are not. The second contradiction, refers to the advance notice period. The original time frame was 30 days now it is 15 days. This creates an in-text contradiction because the contract now becomes ambigious.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Company will carry a reasonable amount of product liability insurance through a reasonably acceptable products liability insurance company but will not name the Distributor as an additional insured under that policy. Company will make reasonable efforts to procure a policy, which is non-cancelable, except upon fifteen (15) days, advance notice to the Distributor.
